title: Issue Tree View and Ready Command
description:
Implement hierarchical tree view for issue dependencies and add sl issue ready command to list unblocked issues. Integrate ready state into /specledger.implement workflow for intelligent task selection.

Key features:
- Tree view for sl issue list --tree with ASCII rendering
- sl issue ready command listing unblocked issues
- sl issue show --tree for single issue context
- /specledger.implement integration using ready state

title: Foundational: Ready State Computation
description:
Core infrastructure that provides the IsReady() method on Issue entity. This MUST complete before any user story can be implemented.

Why: Both tree view and ready command need to determine if an issue is ready (not blocked by open dependencies). This shared logic must exist first.

title: US1: View Issue Dependencies as Tree
description:
As a developer working on a spec, I want to see my issues displayed as a hierarchical tree so that I can quickly understand the dependency relationships between issues and identify which issues block others.

Independent Test: Create issues with dependencies using sl issue link and verify sl issue list --tree shows hierarchical display correctly.

title: US2: List Ready-to-Work Issues
description:
As a developer starting work, I want to see a list of issues that are ready to work on (not blocked by dependencies) so that I can quickly pick up the next available task without manually checking each issue dependencies.

Independent Test: Create issues with various blocking relationships and verify sl issue ready only shows issues where all blocking issues are closed.

title: US3: View Single Issue Dependency Tree
description:
As a developer investigating a specific issue, I want to see its dependency tree so that I can understand what it blocks and what blocks it.

Independent Test: Run sl issue show <id> --tree and verify the tree shows the issue with all its dependencies and dependents.

title: US4: Auto-Select Ready Tasks in Implement Workflow
description:
As a developer running the implementation workflow, I want the system to automatically identify and present ready-to-work tasks (not blocked by dependencies) so that I can focus on actionable work without manually checking dependencies.

Independent Test: Run /specledger.implement on a spec with issues having various dependency states and verify only unblocked issues are presented.

title: Polish: Documentation and Validation
description:
Cross-cutting improvements including documentation updates, quickstart validation, and CLAUDE.md updates.

Purpose: Ensure feature is well-documented and validated against quickstart scenarios.

title: Add IsReady() method to Issue entity
description:
Why: Both tree view and ready command need to determine if an issue is ready (not blocked by open dependencies).

Design (pkg/issues/issue.go):
Add method: func (i *Issue) IsReady(allIssues map[string]*Issue) bool
Logic: Return false if closed. Return true if BlockedBy empty. Check all blockers are closed.

Acceptance:
- Open issue with no blockers → true
- Open issue with closed blockers → true
- Open issue with open blockers → false
- Closed issue → false

title: Add GetBlockers() method to Issue entity
description:
Why: Need to retrieve details about blocking issues for display in ready command output when all issues are blocked.

Design (pkg/issues/issue.go):
Add type: type Blocker struct { ID, Title string; Status IssueStatus }
Add method: func (i *Issue) GetBlockers(allIssues map[string]*Issue) []Blocker

Acceptance:
- Issue with blockers returns slice of Blocker structs
- Issue with broken reference skips missing issue
- Issue with no blockers returns empty slice

title: Add ListReady() method to Store
description:
Why: Provide a convenient way to query all ready issues from the store. Used by sl issue ready command.

Design (pkg/issues/store.go):
Add type: type ReadyIssue struct { Issue; BlockedBy []Blocker }
Add method: func (s *Store) ListReady(filter ListFilter) ([]ReadyIssue, error)
Implementation: Read all issues, build lookup map, filter by IsReady()

Acceptance:
- Returns all issues where IsReady() is true
- Filter by spec context works correctly
- Returns empty slice if no ready issues

title: Create TreeRenderer in pkg/issues/tree.go
description:
Why: Need a dedicated renderer for tree output with configurable options for depth, title width, and status display.

Design (pkg/issues/tree.go - NEW FILE):
Add type: type TreeRenderOptions struct { MaxDepth, ShowStatus, TitleWidth, ShowSpec }
Add type: type TreeRenderer struct { options TreeRenderOptions }
Add method: func NewTreeRenderer(opts TreeRenderOptions) *TreeRenderer

Acceptance:
- TreeRenderer created with default options
- Options configurable (MaxDepth=10, TitleWidth=40, ShowStatus=true)

title: Implement Render() and RenderForest() methods
description:
Why: Need to render dependency tree with ASCII characters for terminal output.

Design (pkg/issues/tree.go):
Use ASCII chars: ├─ (branch), └─ (last), │ (vertical), spaces for indent
func (r *TreeRenderer) Render(tree *DependencyTree) string
func (r *TreeRenderer) RenderForest(trees []*DependencyTree) string

Format: SL-ID [STATUS] Title (truncated)
├── CHILD [STATUS] Child title...
│   └── GRANDCHILD [STATUS] Grandchild...
└── CHILD2 [STATUS] Another...

Acceptance:
- Tree renders with correct indentation
- Connecting lines show hierarchy
- Titles truncated to TitleWidth
- Status shown when ShowStatus=true

title: Add cycle detection and warning in tree output
description:
Why: Cyclic dependencies should not crash the tree renderer. Need to detect cycles and display warning.

Design (pkg/issues/tree.go):
Add cycle detection during rendering using visited map
Display warning at top: Warning: Cyclic dependencies detected
Show cycle path: Cycle: SL-a → SL-b → SL-a
Mark cyclic nodes with warning indicator

Acceptance:
- Cycles detected without crash
- Warning displayed with cycle path
- Cyclic nodes marked in output
- Non-cyclic portions still render

title: Implement --tree flag handling in runIssueList
description:
Why: The --tree flag exists but does not render tree output. Need to implement tree rendering in list command.

Design (pkg/cli/commands/issue.go):
Modify runIssueList to check issueTreeFlag
When true:
1. Load all issues with dependencies
2. Build dependency trees using GetDependencyTree
3. Create TreeRenderer with default options
4. Call RenderForest with root nodes
5. Print tree output instead of table

Acceptance:
- sl issue list --tree shows hierarchical tree
- sl issue list --all --tree groups by spec
- Existing filters (--status, --type) work with --tree

title: Add issueReadyCmd to CLI
description:
Why: Need new sl issue ready command to list unblocked issues.

Design (pkg/cli/commands/issue.go):
Add var: var issueReadyCmd = &cobra.Command{Use: ready, ...}
Register in init(): VarIssueCmd.AddCommand(issueReadyCmd)
Add flags: --all, --json (reuse existing flag vars)

Acceptance:
- sl issue ready command exists
- Help text describes purpose
- Command registered under sl issue

title: Implement runIssueReady function
description:
Why: Core logic for ready command to list unblocked issues.

Design (pkg/cli/commands/issue.go):
func runIssueReady(cmd *cobra.Command, args []string) error
1. Detect spec context (or use --all flag)
2. Create Store and call ListReady()
3. If --json flag, output JSON
4. Otherwise output table: ID, TITLE, STATUS, PRIORITY, SPEC
5. If no ready issues, show blocked message with blocker details

Blocked message format:
No ready issues found.
Blocked issues:
  SL-xxx Title blocked by:
    - SL-yyy Blocker Title (open)

Acceptance:
- Lists only ready issues (not blocked)
- --all searches across all specs
- --json outputs machine-readable format
- Shows helpful message when all blocked

title: Enhance runIssueShow for --tree flag
description:
Why: sl issue show --tree should display issue dependency context (what it blocks, what blocks it).

Design (pkg/cli/commands/issue.go):
Modify runIssueShow to check issueTreeFlag
When true:
1. Call store.GetDependencyTree(issueID)
2. Create TreeRenderer with centered output
3. Render tree showing: BLOCKERS → ISSUE → BLOCKED
4. Print tree instead of details

Format:
Blocked by:
└── SL-blocker1 [open] Blocking issue

SL-current [open] Current Issue

Blocks:
├── SL-blocked1 [open] Blocked issue 1
└── SL-blocked2 [open] Blocked issue 2

Acceptance:
- sl issue show <id> --tree shows dependency context
- Shows both what blocks and what is blocked
- Issue without dependencies shows as standalone

title: Update specledger.implement.md to use sl issue ready
description:
Why: Implement workflow should only present unblocked tasks for selection.

Design (pkg/embedded/skills/commands/specledger.implement.md):
Change task discovery from:
  sl issue list --status open
To:
  sl issue ready

Add handling for when no ready issues:
- Display blocked issues with their blockers
- Offer options: view tree, work on blocker, or exit

Acceptance:
- Workflow queries ready issues
- Only unblocked tasks shown as selectable
- Helpful message when all tasks blocked
- Re-evaluates after task completion

title: Run quickstart.md validation tests
description:
Why: Verify all scenarios from quickstart.md work correctly.

Design: Execute each scenario from quickstart.md:
1. Scenario 1: Tree view with dependencies
2. Scenario 2: Ready issues listing
3. Scenario 3: All issues blocked message
4. Scenario 4: Cross-spec ready with --all
5. Scenario 5: JSON output format
6. Scenario 6: Cycle detection in tree
7. Scenario 7: Implement workflow integration

Acceptance:
- All 7 scenarios pass
- Output matches expected format
- No crashes or errors
